TopicTitle: Kerbin is getting far too hot.

Articles.Content: I\'m not happy with how hot the summer is, is there anyway I can attach giant rockets to Kerbin in order to push it away from Kerbol?
Planets mostly ignore physics in KSP, so you\'re not going to move it that way. Depending on the state of various addons, it might be possible to directly change the orbital parameters.
A kerbin scientist theorized that fires kerbanauts into kerbol decreases the temperature?....

I\'m not happy with how hot the summer is, is there anyway I can attach giant rockets to Kerbin in order to push it away from Kerbol?

If you do that, you\'ll really hate the winters.
Kerbin doesn\'t have any seasons, that requires it\'s rotational axis to the tilted in regards to it\'s orbital plane.

If what you\'re saying is that Kerbin is too close to Kerbol, keep in mind that Kerbol is [theorized] to be a red dwarf. We know that its output is much lower than the Sun\'s, and so therefore Kerbin can sustain life at its current orbit.

In fact Kerbin still needs a strong greenhouse effect to stay warm enough for grass and liquid water. Thankfully the atmosphere appears to have a high molecular weight (from the scale height), and my favorite candidate for a major constituent of it is sulfur hexafluoride, SF6, which is a greenhouse gas.
